info.name: Piles
info.attribution: The rank icon images are by user Ingegneus and are released into the Public Domain through CC0.

406b.text:
Piles can also have routines added to them such as 'clickRoutine' or 'enterRoutine'.

Deck #4 creates a 'clickRoutine' on a pile. You can use the 'INPUT' function to customize what happens when a pile handle is clicked.  This particular input example allows a pile to be flipped and shuffled at the same time.  It also shows how to change the handle to an image. In this case a pentagon is shown. It may take some trial and error with the CSS to get the image to display properly.

Deck #5 takes this a step further and automates what happens when the pile handle is clicked.  In this case, it spreads out the cards.  Click again and it puts them back in a pile.

Deck #6 shows how you could make the piles on the floor different than the piles in the holder.  Create a new pile with a few cards to see.

Deck #7 uses enter and leave routines to count the cards and change the color of the pile handle depending on the number of cards.  Less than 5 is green, 5-8 is orange, and 9-10 is red.

Deck #8 shows how you can use an array of assets, that are displayed depending on the number of cards in a pile. In this case "rank" symbols are used.
